oai_dc:dc.dc:title: WeedML: a Tool for Collaborative Weed Demographic Modeling
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Holst, Niels
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Systems research and participatory research
Education, extension and communication
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: WeedML is a proposed standard to formulate models of weed demography, or maybe even complex models in general, that are both transparent and straightforward to re-use as building blocks for new models. The paper describes the design and thoughts behind WeedML which relies on XML and object-oriented systems development. Proof-of-concept software is provided as open-source C++ code and executables that can be downloaded freely.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Holst, Niels (2010) WeedML: a Tool for Collaborative Weed Demographic Modeling. [.] Weed Science, 58, pp. 497-502.
